pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau meets Prime Minister Paolo Gentiloni of Italy | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Today, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau met Italian Prime Minister Paolo Gentiloni in Rome.

The two leaders explored ways to deepen the strong bilateral relationship that exists between Canada and Italy, which is built on people-to-people ties and common values. The leaders discussed the successful G7 Summit in Taormina and agreed to cooperate closely in the transition to Canada’s G7 presidency in 2018. This cooperation will include building on the G7's on-going attention to gender related issues.

The two leaders also reaffirmed their commitment to the timely ratification and implementation of the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement. ‎
